data.title: SO Disappointed
data.text: It was anniversary dinner. Hostess was rude at the door and looked inconvenienced. Took 20 mins to get water and bread. 1.45 hrs for the food, which came out COLD! Yes, cold fried chicken, COLD iron steak. We left 2 hrs later thoroughly disgusted.... and $110 lighter. I feel robbed.

data.title: Good food average service
data.text: Came here with some friends. Nice wine selections. Had the land special with sausage. This was fantastic. Service was a bit slow but server was very nice.

data.title: Fabulous service, delicious food, a bit pricey
data.text:
We had reservations and were seated promptly.
Our server was knowledgeable about items on the menu and was willing to explain any of it. She knew what the ingredients were, how they were prepared. (She only had to refer to her book once or twice!) She served us in a most professional manner, did not rush us or crowd us, checked on us at appropriate intervals, and kept us supplied in beverages and breads. There was not one thing that our table of 4 did not enjoy. The scallop appetizer was a favorite, as well as the roasted corn salad. The pork tenderloin dinner was beautifully presented and delicious. The chicken was plentiful and then packed up very nicely for take home at the end of the meal. The desserts were a bit disappointing compares to the appetizers and entrees. The honey flavor in the marshmallow for the s'mores was overpowering. The bread pudding was delicious and creative, but the edges were dry so you could not enjoy the whole thing. The French press coffee was a wonderful way to end the evening out.

data.title: People of color.
data.text: Yesterday was my daughter's 31st birthday, n so two girlfriends and myself drove from Charlotte, NC. to have brunch at the Oak Table.  Arriving at 11:45, and at 1:15 still no food, it was clear we were going to the last ones served.  So, it you want sevice take a white friend with you.  Needless to say, I can't review the food because our service did not happen.

data.title: Expensive, but good
data.text: I chose based on TripAdvisor to take two C-Level customer executives. The service was very good. Fare is high-end, mainly farm-to-table. Big focus on fancy cheese apps if you're into that (we weren't). I had the Pig and Peas, which was bacon-wrapped pork over fresh peas and turnips & mashies - very good.

data.title: Excellent Food, Service; Pricey
data.text: The Oak Table: excellent food and service, if a bit pricey.  A six-person family dinner sampled most everything on the menu and nothing disappointed, from several creative starters, through fish and steak dishes to  some tasty desserts.  Excellent mojitos, too.

data.title: Fantastic lunch at The Oak Table
data.text: Had a fabulous lunch at The Oak Table!  We ordered the Pimento Cheese warm appetizer and it was served with a sliced baguette ~ delicious.  I had the Cobb salad with house made dressing that was delicious.  Service was excellent.

data.title: over priced small portions
data.text: This is not all that it was made out to be when it opened. Everything has gone downhill. Not worth it, there are other places to go. But you have a great view of the Statehouse if you sit outside

data.title: Adoption reception / lunch
data.text:
So I'm about a year late making this review.  We had a lot of family and friends attend the adoption of our daughter and we all met here for lunch after court.

The management and staff went above and beyond to give us a memorable afternoon to celebrate our daughter in the private dining area.  The food was fabulous and the support through the entire process was amazing.  Thank you all!

data.title: You must try here.
data.text: This is one of the best restaurant in Columbia we were taken there for Sunday lunch and it was amazing! Food great staff first class and the bar is very well stocked it just across from the state house. I also went again in the evening it was packed I eat at the bar with some friends we all enjoyed it so much I will be going again.

data.title: Special occasions for this fine dining establishment
data.text: This restaurant is a "must visit" for any trip to Columbia.  Located directly across fro the state house, the view is really nice, especially at night.  Lots of farm-to-table specials, all prepared by an extraordinary culinary team.  great variety of entrees, with really nice presentation all around.  This is our special occasions (birthday, wedding anniversary, special friends) choice.

data.title: High expectations for the price
data.text:
I had high expectations while dining with a small group of friends.  I had a burger with truffle fries and while the food was really good and very fresh, the service did not live up to expectations.

We kept having to beg the waiter to come over, waiting 20 minutes for a to-go box for my almost $20.00 burger meal. 

I am a very good tipper and this waiter received the lowest tip as I have ever given in a high end spot.

data.title: Excellent restaurant
data.text:
We were 8 guests for a graduation dinner. Not a lot of room, as the focus seems to be as much on the bar as the restaurant. No dedicated side rooms. Nevertheless, the servers, service, and food were impeccable, despite the recently washed water glasses exploding  as new ice water was poured! No problem-- nobody fainted. 
The wine was over-priced, and the menu was very limited, with various selections already "sold out", but what was available was delectable. I did not try the bone marrow, but understand that this is an appetizer which must be experienced at least once in a lifetime. The fresh catch of the day (?wreck fish) was truly fresh and delectable. Kudos and attaboys to to the chef. Also to the server, who had to deal with 8 raucous multigenerationals.

data.title: Excellent choice.
data.text: As the "Lead" on the project, and being the "gluten free" problem child, I was given the task of selecting the restaurant. And finding a restaurant that has awesome options, and many are or could be made gluten free, this was an easy choice for me. I was very impressed. Ordered a sazerac and it was perfect. Ordered the seared scallops appetizer and it was the best I have ever had. The flavor combinations were spectacular. Dinner was excellent. Ordered the strip steak. Was very flavorful and was tender. Most everyone in my group had the same and all were satisfied. This was an excellent choice, and should I find myself in the area again soon, I will be back.

data.title: Run don't walk...
data.text: Run don't walk to this restaurant!  One of our favorites in Columbia.  The deep fried Lobster and just about everything on the menu rock!!!  Additionally, they have fabulous cocktails.  We've been many times and have never had a bad meal!  It is more refined than any other restaurant in the area.  The atmosphere is wonderful as it is directly across from the beautiful Capital building, so needless to say, the view from the windows in the bar area is very nice.  Service is always top notch as well.  Can't wait to return!

data.title: Birthday with friends
data.text: BEAUTIFUL space and eclectic décor.  Food was creative and beautifully presented in a timely manner.  We started with the quail and scallops appetizers each of which were fantastic and a perfect beginning for 6 people.  Two of us ordered the fish special and while it was good it was heavy on the tomato sauce for both of us which was a surprise based on the description by the server.  Everyone else was pleased with their entrees and we shared 3 desserts which were amazing.  The craft cocktails (The State) were creative and very unique.

data.title: Beautiful Restaurant and Excellent Food
data.text: Our service and food were impeccable at this upscale restaurant near the State Capital Building.  The food is often locally sourced with interesting flavor combinations. The staff was very congenial and our waiter even asked us what we thought about an interesting pickled blackberry that was part of a dessert. The owner has several restaurants in Charleston, but this is the only Columbia restaurant in the group.  Highly recommend and would go again!

data.title: Just Average
data.text: We ate here at the invitation of a work colleague who paid for everyone's meal. The food was outstanding. Overall the dinners were good, but there were some issues.  I had the Hickory Smoked and Fried Colman Farms Chicken. I was not impressed with the chicken being bone-in. In an upscale restaurant such as this, you do not pick up your chicken and eat it with your hands. Yet, while others at our table were given sharper steak knives to cut their meals, I was not. I only had a standard butter knife that comes with the rolled silverware from the start. Cutting fried chicken off the bone with a butter knife is not very easy or practical. In an upscale restaurant you expect the waiter to anticipate these kinds of things and provide you with the proper utensils. Additionally, my meal was the most reasonably priced of the eight dinners at the table for the portion size received. It was $23 and it came with three medium sized pieces of chicken. Most of the other dishes exceed $30 and were half the size of my chicken dinners.

data.title: Pretty Place
data.text: Reservations are a must. Small restaurant with limited seating. Well staffed. Professional and friendly. Beautifully decorated. Nice kitchen. Pimento cheese appetizer was good and filling. Chicken and waffles were ok. Brisket biscuit was good and very filling. Good but not great. Subtle flavors. Pretty place.

data.title: Lunch in famously hot Columbia
data.text:
Enjoyed a wonderful soup and salad with colleagues. The portions were perfect, the soup warm and very tasty and the salad well presented. There were some very tempting deserts but we resisted. My colleagues enjoyed what they said was very good coffee.
The restaurant was a bit understaffed and it took a while to be able to settle the bill.
Was also disappointed with the wine situation. The wine list was not up to date and they were not able to serve the wine we had chosen from their wine offering.
